donor_name: EGYPT UNITED NATIONS DEVELOPMENT FUND FOR WOMEN
outputs.output_descr:
The new Abandonment of Female Genital Mutilation (FGM) & Empowerment of families Joint Programme aims to continue addressing FGM within the context of a larger Family Empowerment Package.  The programme is designed to improve the quality of lives of families with a special focus on marginalized ones.  The national partner also envisions a dire need to continue pushing anti-FGM momentum and hype to implement the criminalization of FGM according to the Egyptian Penal Code (Law passed in June 2008). In addition to the detriments of FGM, the family rights package of the project shall address the following:
•	Economic empowerment through microcredit loans.
•	Early childhood development (childcare, nutrition, etc).
•	Formulation, dissemination and capacity building for a comprehensive socio-cultural family rights counseling package that includes early marriage, maternal child care & family planning, nutrition, etc.       
•	Domestic & Violence against Children Package within the context of the Child Law amendments passed in June 2008.
•	Advocacy component to keep the momentum and maintain family rights and FGM on the agenda of decision makers and media personnel on both local and national levels. This component will incorporate the production and airing of audio-visual materials in addition to supporting an ongoing enlightened dialogue to dilute conservative trends at the governorate level through a series of religious  
socio-cultural forums in 10 governorates in addition to Cairo.

project_title: Abandon Female Genital Mutilation & Empower Families
